steps.title: Welcome
steps.content: Welcome to the Project Euler Editor! This tutorial will help you get started with solving Project Euler problems.

steps.title: Interface Overview
steps.content:
The interface is divided into three main areas:
1. Problem Description (left)
2. Code Editor (right top)
3. Helper Files (right bottom)

steps.title: Selecting a Problem
steps.content: Click on any problem number in the grid to load it. For beginners, we recommend starting with Problem 1.

steps.title: Understanding the Problem
steps.content: Read the problem description carefully. Make sure you understand what is being asked before writing code.

steps.title: Writing Your Solution
steps.content: Use the code editor to write your solution. The editor provides syntax highlighting and auto-completion.

steps.title: The Run Button
steps.content: Click the 'Run Code' button to test your solution. The editor will execute your code and show the result.

steps.title: Understanding Results
steps.content: If your solution is correct, you'll see a success message. If not, you'll get an error message to help you debug.

steps.title: What are Helper Files?
steps.content: Helper files let you organize your code into reusable components. They're great for common functions you use across problems.

steps.title: Creating a Helper File
steps.content: Click 'Add Helper File' to create a new helper file. Give it a descriptive name and write your reusable functions.
